greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Product_{d|n, d>1, d = x^(2k) for some maximal k} prime(k).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
formula: a(n) = Product_{d|n, d>1, r = A052409(d) is even} A000040(r/2).
example: For n = 36, it has three square-divisors: 4 = 2^(2*1), 9 = 3^(2*1) and 36 = 6^(2*1). Thus a(36) = prime(1) * prime(1) * prime(1) = 2*2*2 = 8.
For n = 64, it has three square-divisors: 4 = 2^(2*1), 16 = 2^(2*2) and 64 = 2^(2*3). Thus a(64) = prime(1) * prime(2) * prime(3) = 2*3*5 = 30.
program: (PARI) A294874(n) = { my(m=1,e); fordiv(n,d, if(d>1, e = ispower(d); if((e>1)&&!(e%2), m *= prime(e/2)))); m; };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 11 2017
